intro: Impatiens textorii, commonly known as the purple impatiens, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Balsaminaceae and is characterized by its showy, bilaterally symmetrical flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual herb, reaching heights of up to 30 centimeters. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color, with five petals and a distinctive spurred structure. Impatiens textorii thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
